title: manmohan singh:Former PM Dr Manmohan Singh Thinks There's No Hope Of Economy Reaching $5 Trillion Target By 2024
text:
India is reeling under severe economic crisis and the top economic organisations are saying the same. Despite all of this, Prime Minister Narendra Modi seems confident about his government making sure India reaches the target of five trillion dollars by 2024. However, former Prime Minister and economist Dr Manmohan Singh thinks the Indian economy won't reach this target as the growth rate is "declining year after year".

BCCL

"I have said this publicly before that to reach a goal of five trillion dollar by 2024, as against 2.7 trillion dollar that we had in 2018, would require a growth rate of 10-12 per cent per annum. What is happening in BJP regime is that the government is faced with prospect of a declining rate of growth year after year," Singh said.

"IMF (International Monetary Fund) has come with statement that India's growth rate during the current fiscal year will be only 6.1 per cent as against 7.3 per cent mentioned some months ago. With growth rate declining year after year, I don't think there is any hope of economy reaching the target of five trillion dollars by 2024," he added.

Last month, Singh had stressed the need for adopting a "well-conceived national strategy to make India a five trillion dollar economy".

Singh had said, "Presently our country seems to have slowed down somewhat. The rate of GDP is declining. The investment rate is stagnant. Farmers are in distress. The banking system is facing a crisis, and unemployment is going up. We need a well-conceived national strategy to make India a five trillion dollar economy".

(With inputs from agencies)
